document_title: Chronic tonsillitis: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_name: viem-amidan-man-tinh.json_9_Frequently asked questions about chronic tonsils
subsection_content:
1. Is chronic tonsillitis dangerous?
Chronic tonsillitis can be life-threatening if dangerous complications occur such as meningitis, glomerulonephritis, myocarditis... can lead to death, especially in children.
2. Should chronic tonsillitis be removed?
Tonsillectomy is recommended in immunocompromised patients, with recurrent tonsillitis more than 5 times per year, unresponsive to antibiotic treatment; people with sleep apnea; who develop serious complications…
3. Does chronic tonsillitis cause cancer?
There is no evidence that chronic tonsillitis can turn into cancer. But according to the general inflammation repair mechanism in the body, if the cells are inflamed for a long time, they can weaken and become complicated.

Chronic tonsillitis is one of the most common ENT diseases in both adults and children. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), the proportion of people with tonsillitis accounts for about 30.6% of all respiratory diseases globally. Tonsillitis is not difficult to treat, but if not managed well, it can turn into chronic tonsillitis, causing dangerous complications that can be life-threatening, especially in children.
